content:
These were your instructions that I executed:

The reason you're getting the error:

fatal: adding files failed

along with:

error: 'palios-full-implementation/' does not have a commit checked out

is usually because palios-full-implementation itself contains a nested Git repository (probably from a previous git init). Git won't allow you to directly add and commit a nested Git repository this way.
✅ How to Quickly Fix It:
Step 1: Remove the nested .git folder

Inside your terminal, run:

rm -rf ~/github/palios-taey-nova/palios-full-implementation/.git

This command removes any nested Git tracking inside the folder, turning it into a normal folder.
Step 2: Now, re-add and commit normally

cd ~/github/palios-taey-nova
git add palios-full-implementation
git commit -m "Add PALIOS full implementation"
git push origin main

✅ Why this happened:

    You probably initialized Git (git init) earlier inside the palios-full-implementation folder by mistake, creating a nested repository that causes conflicts.

Removing the nested .git folder resolves the conflict and allows you to commit successfully.

Give this a try—you should be all set! Let me know if you need anything else.
